Title: Mantis: XSS and SQL injection vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Mantis is affected by an SQL injection and several cross-site scripting
    (XSS) vulnerabilities.

Background.Text: Mantis is a web-based bugtracking system written in PHP.

Description.Text: Mantis fails to properly sanitize untrusted input before using it. This leads to an SQL injection and several cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

Impact.Text: An attacker could possibly use the SQL injection vulnerability to access or modify information from the Mantis database. Furthermore the cross-site scripting issues give an attacker the ability to inject and execute malicious script code or to steal cookie-based authentication credentials, potentially compromising the victim's browser.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Mantis users should upgrade to the latest version:
